name: Sigmund Freud on Religion
description: Systematic analysis of Freud’s main writings on religion, studied within the context of central concepts and issues in psychoanalysis such as: the Oedipus Complex, the meaning and function of symbols, the formation of the ego and the superego, and the relations between the individual and culture.
department: Department for the Study of Religion
prerequisites: RLG211Y1/RLG211H1; see note above for general Prerequisites
